const solution = nums => {
  let answer = 0,
    count = nums.length / 2
  let arr = nums.filter((num, index) => {
    return nums.indexOf(num) === index
  })

  arr.length >= count ? (answer = count) : (answer = arr.length)
  return answer
}

function solution(answers) {
  let result = []
  let correctCountArr = [0, 0, 0]
  let studentOne = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
  let studentTwo = [2, 1, 2, 3, 2, 4, 2, 5]
  let studentThree = [3, 3, 1, 1, 2, 2, 4, 4, 5, 5]

  for (let i = 0; i < answers.length; i++) {
    if (studentOne[i % 5] === answers[i]) correctCountArr[0]++
    if (studentTwo[i % 8] === answers[i]) correctCountArr[1]++
    if (studentThree[i % 10] === answers[i]) correctCountArr[2]++
  }

  let numberOneStudent = Math.max(...correctCountArr)

  for (let i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
    if (correctCountArr[i] === numberOneStudent) result.push(i + 1)
  }

  return result.sort((a, b) => a - b)
}

ì•Œê²Œ ëœ ê²ƒ

  1. ìˆ˜í¬ìë“¤ì˜ ì°ê¸°ê°€ ì¼ì • íŒ¨í„´ ì£¼ê¸°ê°€ ìˆì–´ ë°°ì—´ì— ë‹´ê³ , forë¬¸ì„ í†µí•´ ì •ë‹µì§€ ë°°ì—´ê°’ê³¼ ë¹„êµë¥¼ í•˜ë©´ì„œ ì¼ì¹˜í•  ê²½ìš° ë§ì€ íšŸìˆ˜ë¥¼ ë³€ìˆ˜ correctCountArrì— í•˜ë‚˜ì”© ì¦ê°€ ì‹œì¼°ê³ , ìµœì¢…ì ìœ¼ë¡œ ê°€ì¥ ë§ì´ ë§ì¶˜ ê°’ì„ result ë³€ìˆ˜ì— ë‹´ì•„ ë‚´ë¦¼ì°¨ìˆœ ì •ë ¬ í›„ ë°˜í™˜í•˜ì—¬ ë¬¸ì œë¥¼ í•´ê²°í•˜ì˜€ë‹¤.

  2. ë¡œì§ì€ ë¹„ìŠ·í•˜ì§€ë§Œ filterë©”ì„œë“œë¥¼ í†µí•œ ë¬¸ì œí’€ì´ë„ ìˆì—ˆë‹¤.

    # ë‹¤ë¥¸ ì‚¬ëŒ í’€ì´
 function solution(answers) {
    var answer = [];
    var a1 = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5];
    var a2 = [2, 1, 2, 3, 2, 4, 2, 5]
    var a3 = [ 3, 3, 1, 1, 2, 2, 4, 4, 5, 5];

    var a1c = answers.filter((a,i)=> a === a1[i%a1.length]).length;
    var a2c = answers.filter((a,i)=> a === a2[i%a2.length]).length;
    var a3c = answers.filter((a,i)=> a === a3[i%a3.length]).length;
    var max = Math.max(a1c,a2c,a3c);

    if (a1c === max) {answer.push(1)};
    if (a2c === max) {answer.push(2)};
    if (a3c === max) {answer.push(3)};

  return answer;
}

}

item.title: [LeetCode] Two Sum
item.description: ë¬¸ì œ ì„¤ëª… Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target. You mayâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
ë¬¸ì œ ì„¤ëª…

Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice. You can return the answer in any order.

ì…ì¶œë ¥ ì˜ˆ

â–£ ì…ë ¥ì„¤ëª…

nums: Number Array, target: Number

â–£ ì¶œë ¥ì„¤ëª…

Example 1: Input: nums = [2,7,11,15], target = 9 Output: [0,1] Output: Because nums[0] + nums[1] == 9, we return [0, 1].

Example 2: Input: nums = [3,2,4], target = 6 Output: [1,2]

Example 3: Input: nums = [3,3], target = 6 Output: [0,1]

Constraints:

2 <= nums.length <= 104 -109 <= nums[i] <= 109 -109 <= target <= 109 Only one valid answer exists.

Follow-up: Can you come up with an algorithm that is less than O(n2) time complexity?

ë‚˜ì˜ í’€ì´

var twoSum = function(arr, target) {
  var result = []

  for (var i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) {
    for (var j = i + 1; j < arr.length; j++) {
      if (arr[i] + arr[j] === target) {
        result.push(i, j)
      }
    }
  }
  return result
}

ë‹¤ë¥¸ ì‚¬ëŒì˜ í’€ì´

# 1. Hash Table ì‚¬ìš©
var twoSum = function(nums, target) {
  const container = {};

  for (let i = 0; i < nums.length / 2; i++) {
    const complement = target - nums[i];

    if (complement in container) return [container[complement], i];

    container[nums[i]] = i;
  }
}

# 2. Map ì‚¬ìš©
var twoSum = function(nums, target) {
  const container = new Map;

  for (let i = 0; i < nums.length; i++) {
    const complement = target - nums[i];

    if (container.has(complement)) return [container.get(complement), i];

    container.set(nums[i], i);
  }
}

function solution(strings, n) {

# ë‹¤ë¥¸ ì‚¬ëŒ í’€ì´ 1
function solution(strings, n) {
    return strings.sort((a, b) => {
        const chr1 = a.charAt(n);
        const chr2 = b.charAt(n);

        if (chr1 == chr2) {
            return (a > b) - (a < b);
        } else {
            return (chr1 > chr2) - (chr1 < chr2);
        }
    })
}

# ë‹¤ë¥¸ ì‚¬ëŒ í’€ì´ 2
function solution(strings, n) {
    var answer = [];
    for (var i = 0; i < strings.length; i++) {
        var chu = strings[i][n];
        strings[i] = chu + strings[i];
    }
    strings.sort();
    for (var j = 0; j < strings.length; j++) {
        strings[j] = strings[j].replace(strings[j][0],"");
        answer.push(strings[j])
    }

    return answer;
}

  else answer=s.substring(mid-1, mid+1);

}

function solution (arr) {
  let result = arr.reduce((acc, cur) => acc + cur, 0);
  for (let i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
    for (let j = 1; j < 9; j++) {
      if (result - (arr[i] + arr[j]) == 100) {
        arr.splice(arr.indexOf(arr[j]), 1);
        arr.splice(arr.indexOf(arr[i]), 1);
      }
    }
  }
  return arr;
}

solution([20, 7, 23, 19, 10, 15, 25, 8, 13]); // [20, 7, 23, 19,10, 8, 13]

function solution(arr){
  let answer=[];
  let oddNum = arr.filter(item => (item % 2 == 1));
  let minOddNum = Math.min.apply(null, oddNum);
  
  let oddNumTotalValue = oddNum.reduce((acc, cur) => Number(acc + cur));
  answer.push(oddNumTotalValue, minOddNum);
  return answer;
}

  3. ë¬¸ì œ ë‹µì•ˆì—ì„œëŠ” for of ë¬¸ì„ í†µí•´ ì•„ë˜ì™€ ê°™ì´ í•´ê²°í•˜ì˜€ë‹¤.

    function solution(arr){
	let answer=[];
	let sum=0, min=1000;
	for(let x of arr){
		if(x%2===1){
			sum+=x;
		if(x<min) min=x;
		}
	}
	answer.push(sum);
	answer.push(min);     
	return answer;
}

  let answer="YES", max;

  if (a > b) max = a;

function solution(a, b) {
    let answer = 0;
    if (a > b) {
        for(let i = b; i <= a; i++) {
            answer += i
        }
    } else if (a < b) {
        for(let i = a; i <= b; i++) {
            answer += i
        }
    } else {
        answer = a
    }
    return answer;
}

function solution(num) {
    let answer = 0;
    while (num != 1) {

    };
    return answer;
};

 return !(x % (x + "").split("").reduce((a, b) => +b + +a ));

function solution(x) {

function solution(s) {
  let answer = ''
  if (s.length % 2 == 0) {
    const a = s.length / 2
    const b = a - 1
    answer += s[b]
    answer += s[a]
  } else {
    answer += s[parseInt(s.length / 2)]
  }
  return answer
}
